newsitem.title: BELGIUM: New Year date change hits Brussels bourse system.
newsitem.headline: New Year date change hits Brussels bourse system.

text.p: The Brussels Stock Exchange said on Thursday the opening of the bourse was delayed due to the New Year date change.

"There is a technical problem with the change of date which is causing problems in one programme, this is currently being solved so I expect it to open in one hour," bourse director Olivier Lefebvre told Reuters at 1030 GMT.
He said that if the bourse could open within the next hour opening hours would probably not be extended.
Lefebvre said one of the problems was that orders which were placed on December 30, the last trading day of 1996, were now recognised as December 1997 orders.
This prevented investors and brokerages from changing their orders to reflect Wall Street's Tuesday plunge.
It is the most serious technical problem to have hit the bourse since a new trading system was installed last year.
